questions.question_text: A user's computer is quick to boot up but very slow at login. It tends to get faster throughout the day. A technician checks the RAM usage, and it looks fine during the day. The slowdown is MOST likely being caused by too many:

discussion.content:
The only issue I have with this question is that the problem decreases throughout the day. My first thought with slow logon assuming it is an office with a domain controller is that there are roaming profiles loading. If all the workers log on at the start of the day then there is a lot of traffic on the network which can make loading slow. As the day goes on however, everyone isn't loading their profiles all at once, so it is faster. 

Maybe I'm over thinking but that's my thought process.

comments.content: D. Windows profiles loading. is your answer?

A fair point but i think if that were the case there would be more than one user reporting the issue.
Since it's only one i think the answer is B. Too many startup applications will slow the machine down after login but should balance out once they've all finished loading up.
